title: History Report (Help Appreciated)
content:
For my Typography class, I am creating an alphabet book (similar to a child’s) that basically gives a timeline of fonts and typefaces from the year 1950 - 2000.

My goal is to find 5 fonts from each decade between these years and outline a basic history of each. (50’s, 60’s, 70’s, 80’s, 90’s, and a year 2000 page)

This is not a commercial endeavor - however, depending on the final product, it could be. As such, if you provide me with a link, an article, etc. that helps me accomplish this goal, I will include your name in an Acknowledgements section.

Thanks for any help! I will be scanning the finished book upon completion so you can see.

 [‹ Chaparral-like fonts?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102112224/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38561 "Go to previous forum topic") [Time for a change ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102112224/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38425 "Go to next forum topic")
author: g10tto

comments.content: The ’Prowling the specimen books’ section in ’Elements of Typographic Style’ has a lot of the information you seem to be looking for in one place. Do you have access to a copy?
